CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1969, pg. 2, reads: "Marchers And Closed Sites. The controversial, paramilitary Black Berets of Homewood complete with their police dogs, lead a portion of the Black Coalition toward construction sites in Oakland Monday. Some 800 marchers were successful in closing Three Rivers Stadium, center photo, and a building at Duquesne University.  The march Monday was peaceful and orderly in contrast to the violence which took place Tuesday.  Coalition leade[r]s have vowed to continue the daily protests until their job demands are met. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Three Rivers Stadium during construction, with sign for US Steel American Bridge Company
